OCD.name: Timer
OCD.description: A wire component that fires a ticking event on every configured interval

AD.name: type
AD.description: The type specifier for the interval

AD.name: simple.interval
AD.description: Interval of the timer ticks, in the time unit specified by the simple.time.unit property. This value is used when type is set to SIMPLE.

AD.name: simple.time.unit
AD.description: The time unit to be used if SIMPLE type is selected

AD.name: simple.first.tick.policy
AD.description: Specifies the timer starting tick behavior. When set to DEFAULT the timer waits the time interval specified in simple.interval and simple.time.unit before executing the first time tick. When set to custom, the user can specify in simple.custom.first.tick.interval an interval before the first tick.

AD.name: simple.custom.first.tick.interval
AD.description: Custom time before first tick. Effective only when simple.first.tick.policy is set to CUSTOM. This field uses the time unit specified in simple.time.unit.

AD.name: cron.interval
AD.description: Interval in CRON expression (Needs to be set if CRON type is selected) (For more information, please visit http://www.cronmaker.com/ to create your own CRON expression)
